Class GameLogicController

java.lang.Object
pl.polsl.lab1.oliwier.gebczynski.myfirstmvp.controller.GameLogicController
public class GameLogicController extends Object
This class handles the core game logic of the Snake game, including board management, snake movement, collision detection, and game state updates.
Version:
1.2
Author:
Oliwier Gebczynski

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static enum 
    GameLogicController.GameState
    Enum representing the possible game states.
    static interface 
    GameLogicController.PointChecker
    A functional interface used to check if a point (segment) lies within a specified area.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameLogicController

      public GameLogicController(Player player, String snakeColorName)
      Constructs a new GameLogicController instance with the provided player and snake color.
      Parameters:
      player - The player object associated with the game.
      snakeColorName - A string representing the desired snake color (e.g., "Blue", "Red", "Yellow"). Defaults to green if not a valid color name.

  • Method Details

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Initializes the game by creating a new board, setting the initial snake direction, and resetting game over state.

    • changeDirection

      public void changeDirection(int keyCode)
      Allows the player to change the snake's direction based on the provided key code. Prevents the snake from moving backwards immediately.
      Parameters:
      keyCode - The key code representing the pressed arrow key.

    • updateGameState

      public boolean updateGameState()
      Updates the game state by moving the snake, checking for collisions, handling food consumption, and incrementing the player's score. Returns true if the game is still ongoing, false otherwise.
      Returns:
      True if the game is not over, false otherwise.

    • render

      public void render(Graphics g)
      Renders the current game state (board, snake, candy, score, and game over message) onto the graphics object. This method should be called in the paintComponent method of the view to draw the game scene.
      Parameters:
      g - The Graphics object used to render the game elements.

    • countSnakeSegmentsInArea

      public int countSnakeSegmentsInArea(Point topLeft, Point bottomRight)
      Counts how many segments of the snake's body are within a specified rectangular area of the board.
      Parameters:
      topLeft - The top-left corner of the rectangular area.
      bottomRight - The bottom-right corner of the rectangular area.
      Returns:
      The number of snake segments within the specified area.

    • addExtraCandies

      public void addExtraCandies(Point... ExtraCandies)
      Adds extra candies to the game at specified points. This method allows for the addition of multiple candies on the board by providing their coordinates as arguments.
      Parameters:
      ExtraCandies - An array of points where extra candies should be added.
      See Also:
      • Board.spawnExtraCandies(Point)

    • areAllSnakeSegmentsInArea

      public boolean areAllSnakeSegmentsInArea(Point topLeft, Point bottomRight)
      Checks if all snake segments are within a specified area. This method uses the GameLogicController.PointChecker interface to check whether each snake segment is within the rectangular area defined by two points.
      Parameters:
      topLeft - The top-left corner of the rectangle defining the area.
      bottomRight - The bottom-right corner of the rectangle defining the area.
      Returns:
      true if all snake segments are within the area, otherwise false.
      See Also:
      • GameLogicController.PointChecker.isInArea(Point, Point, Point)

    • getScore

      public int getScore()
      Gets the current score of the player.
      Returns:
      The player's score.

    • getPlayerName

      public String getPlayerName()
      Gets the name of the player.
      Returns:
      The player's name.
